Articles.Content:
Can someone explain this:

[ATTACH=CONFIG]33795[/ATTACH]

:/

...err, yeah.
I also saw that someone had "Dildo Kerman" or something along those lines
Your signature fits my reaction perfectly:
defenetly intended
The game uses a random name generator that stitches syllables together. Sometimes unfortunate similarities with words are made.
Who cares, I say keep it. Hell, we don't know what words mean in the Kerbal language now do we?
Not inappropropriate, but I currently have an "Oblong Kerman" in my mun base. Actually, now that I look at him, he is kinda rectangular.
Luzer Kerman flew one of my scarier designs. Fun night.
So long as we are all mature enough to handle them, I don't think it should be a problem.

I don't know what "Hardon" means so I don't find it offensive~

But if it's an inappropriate word it should obviously get dealt with.

Hard-on in English slang mean "aroused" like in "I have an hard-on". Though, I don't see why is should be offensive. If it was racist, maybe, but, here, that would be as stupid as banning "Dick" as a name.

And, if you start going that way, soon everyone would like to delete a name because it may potentially be offensive in any language. Let's not go this way.

Hard-on in English slang mean "aroused" like in "I have an hard-on". Though, I don't see why is should be offensive. If it was racist, maybe, but, here, that would be as stupid as banning "Dick" as a name.

And, if you start going that way, soon everyone would like to delete a name because it may potentially be offensive in any language. Let's not go this way.

Yeah, agree'd.

I don't think they should ban any names if it's not a well known offensive word.

It may be a bit inappropriate, but I'm actually a bit curious of the thought process of people who find words such as "hardon" super-offensive and start media-****storms about them. Do they crawl up in a fetal position upon seeing the word, cry themselves to sleep and start seeing shrinks to help them endure their personal hardon-crisis?
Must be the same person that cry and yell when they see a breast during the Olympic Games.

It may be a bit inappropriate, but I'm actually a bit curious of the thought process of people who find words such as "hardon" super-offensive and start media-****storms about them. Do they crawl up in a fetal position upon seeing the word, cry themselves to sleep and start seeing shrinks to help them endure their personal hardon-crisis?

I lol'd heartily.

I'm amazed there were no Top Gun jokes yet.

(Your Kerbal was obviously sensing MiGs nearby
I feel the need...
I'm so sorry about this but i just had too... "I feel the need... " The need for speed !!

I'm so sorry about this but i just had too... "I feel the need... " The need for speed !!

You can be my wingman anytime ..
For a second I thought his name was "Hadron", that would have been cool.

For a second I thought his name was "Hadron", that would have been cool.

Funnily enough, I'm sure I've seen a Hadron Kerman at some point. To get to 'Hardon' from 'Hadron' you just need to switch two letters around...

personal hardon-crisis?

Oh god my root beer is coming out my nose. It hurts like heck. Thanks a lot.

personal hardon-crisis?

Oh god my root beer is coming out my nose. It hurts like heck. Thanks a lot.

[ATTACH=CONFIG]33821[/ATTACH]

OK, OK, I'm done....

I too had a Hadron Kerman, we had to let him go though. He had a tendency to collide with things.

Edited September 28, 2012 by techonce
fixed typo
Someone recently had a Dildo Kerman in one of their pictures.
